question: What is the submission process for research papers?
answer: Submissions for research papers must adhere to the ACM template and format and be in PDF format. They must be self-contained and written in English. The review process will be double-blind, so the submitted document should omit any author names, affiliations, or other identifying information. Submissions that do not follow these guidelines or do not view or print properly will be rejected without review. The abstract submission deadline is October 6, 2022, and the full paper submission deadline is October 13, 2022, This is compulsory for all papers. All submission deadlines are end-of-day in the Anywhere on Earth (AoE) time zone.
from: WWW2023/calls/Research Tracks/TheWebConf 2023 Research Tracks Final Call For Papers (CFP) 'Web Research with Openness, Fairness and Reproducibility'/Instructions for authors of research tracks submissions

question: Where can I download the conference paper template?
answer: Submissions must adhere to the ACM template and format, which you can find in https://www.acm.org/publications/proceedings-template. Word users may use Word Interim Template, and LaTeX users may use the “sample-sigconf” template. Overleaf users may want to use the ACM proceedings template available in Overleaf, and the link is https://www.overleaf.com/latex/templates/association-for-computing-machinery-acm-sig-proceedings-template/bmvfhcdnxfty.
from: WWW2023/calls/Research Tracks/TheWebConf 2023 Research Tracks Final Call For Papers (CFP) 'Web Research with Openness, Fairness and Reproducibility'/FormattingSubmissions/Adherence, WWW2023/calls/Research Tracks/TheWebConf 2023 Research Tracks Final Call For Papers (CFP) 'Web Research with Openness, Fairness and Reproducibility'/FormattingSubmissions/TemplateFormats

question: Do we have to submit an abstract before the manuscript deadline?
answer: Abstract submission is compulsory for all papers and must be done before the manuscript deadline. The abstract submission deadline is October 6, 2022, , and it is end-of-day in the Anywhere on Earth (AoE) time zone.
from: WWW2023/calls/Research Tracks/TheWebConf 2023 Research Tracks Final Call For Papers (CFP) 'Web Research with Openness, Fairness and Reproducibility'/Instructions for authors of research tracks submissions/ImportantDates

answer: Yes

question: What are the side events organized alongside the main conference?
answer: Events organized alongside the main conference are W4A, Web Sci2023 and ProvenanceWeek

question: Is there any other grant besides the student travel award for conference participants?
answer: Yes, this conference also offers a Virtual Participation Award

question: Are there any workshops related to knowledge graph?
answer: Yes, their titles are “Trusting Decentralised Knowledge Graphs and Web Data (TrusDeKW)”, “Beyond Facts: 3d International Workshop on Knowledge Graphs for Online Discourse Analysis”, “The First International Workshop on Knowledge Graphs for Sustainability - KG4S”
from: WWW2023/Program/Accepted Workshops

question: How many workshops are there in this conference?
answer: There are 21 workshops in this conference.
from: WWW2023/Program/Accepted Workshops

question: Are there any tutorials related to graph neural network(GNN) in this conference? If so, what are their title and organizers?
answer: Yes, there are two tutorials related to graph neural network in this conference. One is “Graph Neural Networks: Foundation, Frontiers and Applications” and the organizers are Lingfei Wu, Peng Cui, Jian Pei, Liang Zhao and Xiaojie Guo and the other is “Graph Neural Networks for Tabular Data Learning” and the Organizers are Cheng-Te Li, Yu-Che Tsai and Jay Chiehen Liao.
from: WWW2023/Program/Accepted Tutorials

question: Are there any tutorials related to multi modal in this conference? If so, what are their title and organizers?
answer: Yes, there is a tutorial related to multi modal in this conference. The title of the tutorial is “Model Monitoring in Practice: Lessons Learned and Open Challenges” and the organizers are Krishnaram Kenthapadi, Himabindu Lakkaraju, Pradeep Natarajan and Mehrnoosh Sameki.
from: WWW2023/Program/Accepted Tutorials

question: How many keynotes are there in this conference?
answer: there are 5 keynotes in this conference
from: WWW2023/Program/Keynotes

question: Are there any keynotes related to graph neural network(GNN) in this conference? If so, what are their title and authors?
answer: Yes, there is a keynote speech related to Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) in this conference. The title of the keynote is “Graph generative models and their potential in the biomedical domain” and the speaker is Michalis Vazirgiannis.
from: WWW2023/Program/Keynotes/4

question: How many options are there if divide the registration type according to the time period?
answer:
There will be three options: 
Full Conference (5 days: April 30 - May 4), Workshop, Tutorial.
Special Days, W4A, WebSci, Provenance (2 Days: April 30 - May 1).
Main Conference (3 days: May 2 - May 4)
